section.name: Configuration

subsection.name: Adding related docs to your node definition

section.subsection:
To add the related documents functionality to your documents, you need to follow two steps. First you need to extend your document type with relateddocs:relatabledocs. Open your CND file and add the relateddocs namespace to it on the top.
<relateddocs='http://forge.onehippo.org/relateddocs/nt/1.1'> Now extend the document type you want to use as relatable document. These type of documents are retrieved automatically in the related docs suggestions.
Assuming that your project's namespace is demo and the document type is textpage, you need to addthe relateddocs:relatabledocs as shown below to your CND file. [demo:textpage] > hippostd:publishable, hippostd:publishableSummary, hippo:document, relateddocs:relatabledocs

subsection.name: Adding related docs to your template

section.subsection:
After you have added the relateddocs node to your cnd file, you need to modify the backend template for the type, so that it will show the documents. Open your namespace definition or the XML file in which you have defined the type for your type textpage. First add the supertype declaration to your document type textpage.
<sv:property sv:name="hipposysedit:supertype" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>hippo:document</sv:value> <sv:value>hippostd:publishable</sv:value> <sv:value>hippostd:publishableSummary</sv:value> <sv:value>relateddocs:relatabledocs</sv:value> </sv:property>
To display the relateddocs field the follwoing snippet should be added to the backend template under the hippo:template.
<sv:node sv:name="relateddocs"> <sv:property sv:name="jcr:primaryType" sv:type="Name"> <sv:value>frontend:plugin</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="caption" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>Related documents</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="engine" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>${engine}</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="mode" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>${mode}</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="plugin.class" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>org.onehippo.forge.relateddocs.editor.RelatedDocsPlugin</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="template.size" sv:type="String"> <sv:value/> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="wicket.id" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>${cluster.id}.field</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="search.paths" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>/content/documents/myproject</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="wicket.model" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>${wicket.model}</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="browser.id" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>service.browse</sv:value> </sv:property> </sv:node>
For the suggestions field to be displayed in the backend template for the type, you need to add the following to the hippo:template:
<sv:node sv:name="relateddocssuggest"> <sv:property sv:name="jcr:primaryType" sv:type="Name"> <sv:value>frontend:plugin</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="caption" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>Related documents suggestion</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="engine" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>${engine}</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="mode" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>${mode}</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="plugin.class" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>org.onehippo.forge.relateddocs.editor.RelatedDocsSuggestPlugin</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="template.size" sv:type="String"> <sv:value/> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="numberOfSuggestions" sv:type="Long"> <sv:value>20</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="wicket.id" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>${cluster.id}.field</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="wicket.model" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>${wicket.model}</sv:value> </sv:property> <sv:property sv:name="browser.id" sv:type="String"> <sv:value>service.browse</sv:value> </sv:property> </sv:node>
